page.title: 11 ENTERTAINMENT IN FOLKESTONE
page.content: {LEAS PAVILION THEATRE}-founded 1928. Halcyon days 1929-1969 under Arthur Brough. Charles Vance now continues the tradition of actor manager. The summer season contains a variety of plays. {F.H.O.D.S.}-Amateur dramatics at the Little Theatre, Sandgate. Light opera and dramatic shows. {THREE LOCAL CHOIRS}-range from madrigals to oratorio. {ONE CINEMA}- three screens. {LEAS CLIFF HALL}-wide range of entertainment including wrestling, disco, classical and pop concerts. {METROPOLE ARTS CENTRE}-opened 1961. Focal point for cultural interests.It has a reputation as an out-of-London gallery, having exhibited works from Moore to Piper, and Constable to Frink. It is also used for adult education classes in art and crafts.
